subject: Re: [junit] Problem in Testing Expected Exception
msgSnippet: Don t extend from TestCase if you are using JUnit 4 annotations. Jeff
messageBody:
Don't extend from TestCase if you are using JUnit 4 annotations.

Jeff

> I am following the example here to test expected exception:
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm
>
> So I have
> public class TestOperation extends TestCase {
>
>
> @Test(expected = IndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
> public void testempty() {
> new ArrayList<Object>().get(0);
> }
> }
>
> But when I run it under ecliplse 3.4, the test case * fails*.
>
> Can you please tell me why? I expected the test case *passes*. I am
> using junit 4.4 with jdk 1.6.
>
> java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
